When an object is moving in a circular motion vertically, it will have a different centripetal force at each position. The force of gravity $ \vec {F}_g $ always points down, while the force of tension from the rope $ \vec {F}_T $ always points to the center of the circle.
At the top of circle, both the force of tension and gravity point downwards. At the bottom of the circle, the tension force points upwards, while the force of gravity points down.
Please note that the centripetal force $ \vec {F}_c $ is the **net force** in the system, not to be confused by the tension force.
